long_desc.thetext:
When JDT/Core will move up to 3.10.0 one of the regular expressions in export-ecj.xml will no longer work, see this snippet:
<condition property="bundleVersionOK"> <matches pattern="\d\.\d\.\d.*" string="${bundleVersion}"/> </condition> <fail message="bundleVersion variable had unexpected format. Should be digit.digit.digit,ANY but was ${bundleVersion}" unless="bundleVersionOK"/> <script language="javascript"> var bundleVersion = project.getProperty("bundleVersion"); var pattern = new RegExp(/^(\d+)\.(\d+)\.(\d+)\.(.*)$/);
the final pattern will work for 3.10.0, too, but the former will not, since it lacks the '+' tokens. Also the fail message could use improvement at that time.
BTW: when are we going to bump it up to 3.10.0?

Should it be 3.10 or 4.0 or something else? I am not sure.
Hoping Dani can throw some light on this.

(In reply to comment #1) > Should it be 3.10 or 4.0 or something else? I am not sure. > > Hoping Dani can throw some light on this.
http://wiki.eclipse.org/Version_Numbering is a good friend.

(In reply to comment #1) > Should it be 3.10 or 4.0 or something else? I am not sure.
By saying "4.0" we would indicate some breaking API change, right? I don't think such a thing is planned :) That's why I think we'll just keep counting the minor segment.
The idea being: consumers depending on s.t. like jdt.core[3.5,4.0) should be able to bind to our next release without needing to adjust their dependencies.

(In reply to comment #3) > (In reply to comment #1) > > Should it be 3.10 or 4.0 or something else? I am not sure. > > By saying "4.0" we would indicate some breaking API change, right? > I don't think such a thing is planned :)
No, not at all. I got carried away by the decimal in front of the '9' :) Agree it should be 3.10.0

(In reply to comment #0) > BTW: when are we going to bump it up to 3.10.0?
I have bumped the version for the projects changed so far in Luna.

Inside export-ecj.jar I updated the hard-coded default to "3.10.0.qualifier".
Next I watched the ant build fail.
After adjusting the regex it is now working again.
Released for 4.4 M1 via commit 2d7346a2b7276b60e538d12fbe58324d037f84a1
